steps.title: Welcome
steps.description: A playbook is the execution plan that ties identity, content, and measurement specs together into a complete tutor configuration. This demo shows how to build and publish one.

content.body:
# Build and Publish a Playbook

A **playbook** is the glue that holds a tutor together. It bundles:

- **Identity Spec** — WHO the tutor is
- **Measurement Specs** — HOW the tutor learns about each caller
- **Content Spec** — WHAT the tutor teaches

## Why playbooks matter

Without a playbook, specs are just standalone definitions. The playbook tells the pipeline **which specs to run, in what order, for which domain**.

Publishing a playbook makes it live — callers will experience the configuration you define.

## Time: ~6 minutes

Use **← →** arrow keys or the buttons below to navigate.

steps.reason: Understanding the playbook concept is essential before building one. Playbooks are the bridge between spec definitions and live tutor behavior.
steps.goal: Orient the viewer on what playbooks are and why they matter

tips.message: Arrow keys navigate, Space toggles autoplay, ? opens AI assistant

aiContext.action: Starting the Build and Publish a Playbook demo

steps.title: Open Playbooks
steps.description: Navigate to the Playbooks page using the sidebar. This is where you manage all playbook configurations across your domains.
steps.reason: The Playbooks page is the central management hub for all playbook configurations. Each playbook belongs to a domain and defines a complete tutor experience.

steps.title: Create New Playbook
steps.description: Click 'New Playbook' to start creating a playbook. You'll name it, give it a description, and select which domain it serves.

content.alt: Playbooks page with New Playbook button and creation form

steps.reason: The playbook name and description help team members understand what this configuration does. Choose a name that reflects the domain and purpose.

tips.message: Name playbooks descriptively, e.g., 'QM Tutor - Adaptive v2' so team members can tell them apart

aiContext.currentView: Playbooks page with creation form open

steps.title: Select Domain
steps.description: Choose which domain this playbook serves. A playbook belongs to exactly one domain, and a domain can have multiple playbooks (but only one published at a time).

content.alt: Domain selector dropdown in playbook form

steps.reason: Each playbook is tied to a domain. This ensures that specs, content, and measurements are scoped correctly. Only one playbook can be published (live) per domain at any time.

tips.message: You can have draft playbooks alongside a published one — useful for testing new configurations

aiContext.action: Selecting which domain the playbook belongs to

steps.title: Add Identity Spec
steps.description: Add the identity spec that defines WHO the tutor is. Every playbook needs exactly one identity spec — it controls personality, teaching style, and boundaries.

content.alt: PlaybookBuilder with identity spec being added

steps.reason: The identity spec is the foundation. Without it, the tutor has no personality or teaching guidelines. It must be marked as required — the playbook cannot activate without one.
steps.goal: Add the tutor's identity definition to the playbook

tips.message: Every playbook must have exactly one IDENTITY spec. The system will flag a validation error if it's missing.

aiContext.action: Adding the identity spec (TUT-001) to the playbook

steps.title: Add Measurement Specs
steps.description: Add PERS-001 (personality measurement) and VARK-001 (learning modality). These EXTRACT specs analyze conversations and build caller profiles over time.
steps.reason: Measurement specs make the tutor adaptive. PERS-001 measures Big Five personality traits (openness, conscientiousness, etc.) and VARK-001 detects learning modality (visual, auditory, read/write, kinesthetic). Together they power personalization.
steps.goal: Enable adaptive learning by adding measurement specs

tips.message: PERS-001 and VARK-001 are the recommended baseline — they provide enough data for meaningful adaptation

aiContext.action: Adding PERS-001 and VARK-001 measurement specs

steps.title: Add Content Spec
steps.description: Link the content/teaching spec that defines WHAT the tutor teaches. This connects to your content sources and curriculum structure.

content.alt: PlaybookBuilder with content spec added alongside identity and measurement

steps.reason: The content spec connects the playbook to your teaching material. It defines what the tutor can teach, references content sources with trust levels, and controls how the AI uses that material.

tips.message: Content specs reference Content Sources — make sure you've uploaded your curriculum before linking it here

aiContext.action: Adding the content/teaching spec to the playbook

steps.title: Review & Publish
steps.description: Review the complete playbook configuration, then publish it to make it live for callers. Publishing replaces any currently published playbook for this domain.

left.alt: Playbook review panel with all specs listed and Publish button

right.body:
## Publish Workflow

1. **Review** — All specs are listed with their roles and status
2. **Validate** — The system checks for required items (identity, at least one content or measurement spec)
3. **Publish** — This playbook becomes the active configuration for the domain

### What happens when you publish?

- The previous published playbook (if any) is **unpublished** automatically
- New calls use the new configuration immediately
- Existing in-progress calls finish with their original configuration
- You can unpublish and revert at any time

### Draft vs. Published

- **Draft**: Only visible to team members, not used by the pipeline
- **Published**: Live — the pipeline uses this playbook for all new calls

steps.reason: Publishing is the critical step that makes your configuration live. Always review before publishing, especially in production domains with active callers.
steps.goal: Publish the playbook to make it live for callers

tips.message: Publishing immediately affects new calls. Review carefully in production domains.

aiContext.currentView: Playbook review panel with publish workflow — split view
aiContext.action: Reviewing playbook configuration and preparing to publish

steps.title: Verify in Domain
steps.description: After publishing, navigate to the domain to confirm the playbook is active. The domain overview shows which playbook is currently published.

content.body:
# Playbook Published

Your playbook is now live. Here's how to verify and what to do next:

## Verify

1. **Go to Domains** — Open the domain you published to
2. **Check the playbook badge** — It should show your playbook name with a "Published" status
3. **Run a test call** — Open the Simulator and verify the tutor behaves as expected

## What You Built

- ✅ **Identity Spec** — Defines WHO the tutor is
- ✅ **Measurement Specs** — PERS-001 + VARK-001 for adaptive learning
- ✅ **Content Spec** — Links to your teaching material
- ✅ **Published** — Live and active for callers

## Next Steps

1. **Test in Simulator** — Verify the tutor's personality and teaching behavior
2. **Monitor adaptation** — Watch how personality profiles build over calls
3. **Iterate** — Create a new draft playbook to test changes safely
4. **Add more specs** — Expand measurement or add specialized content

## Related Demos

- *Create a Tutor Domain from Scratch* (DEMO-TUTOR-001)
- *See How Adaptive Learning Works* (DEMO-ADAPT-001)
- *Monitor Learning Goals Across Callers* (DEMO-GOALS-001)

steps.reason: Verification confirms the publish was successful. Testing in the Simulator ensures the tutor behaves as expected before real callers interact with it.
